intro: Linnaea borealis f. latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leafed twinflower, is a rare variant of the twinflower plant native to the northern regions of North America and Eurasia. It is a low-growing evergreen shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves and fragrant, bell-shaped white flowers. The leaves of this form are broader and more elongated compared to the typical species, giving it a distinct appearance. It thrives in shaded, moist environments such as boreal forests and rocky slopes. This plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and its role in supporting local pollinators.
